reasoning: Extremely rare benign nail tumor of the nail matrix. Prevalence less than 1 per 1,000,000 worldwide. As of 2016, fewer than 80 cases reported in medical literature. Peak incidence in 5th decade of life in Caucasian women. Frequently misdiagnosed as onychomycosis. Limited robust epidemiological data due to extreme rarity and limited case reports.
source: Orphanet database; Emedicine Medscape article on Onychomatricoma
